# NIDeviceCapability

**Protocol**

An interface that adds Boolean values that indicate an interaction session feature support.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NIDeviceCapability
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISession] class property [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISession/deviceCapabilities] adopts this protocol. At runtime, inspect this property to determine the available features of an interaction session on the person’s device.

In a compatible iPad or iPhone app running in visionOS, the framework reports that all capabilities are unavailable.

## Session features

- **supportsPreciseDistanceMeasurement**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the device produces precise distance measurements to nearby objects.
- **supportsDirectionMeasurement**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the device produces instantaneous direction measurements to nearby objects.
- **supportsCameraAssistance**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the device can leverage ARKit to improve interaction.
- **supportsExtendedDistanceMeasurement**: A Boolean value that indicates whether this device supports extended distance measurement.
- **supportsDLTDOAMeasurement**: A property that indicates if the device supports Downlink Time-Difference-of-Arrival ranging.

## Ensuring feature support

- **deviceCapabilities**: An object that communicates the device’s supported framework features.
